CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 5 - Right to liberty and security (Article 5-4 - Procedural guarantees of review)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lived before his arrest in LOC . He is currently detained in the town of GPE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant , while being on the wanted list after having breached his undertaking not to leave the place of his residence , was arrested on the charges of violent acts against a public official ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW of GPE ) . On DATE the Severodvinsk Town Court of LOC authorised his detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant asked ORG to apply a non - custodial restraint measure to him . The applicant and his lawyer attended the hearing and made oral submissions . ORG dismissed the motion for release , having referred , in particular , to the applicant ’s criminal record , which included CARDINAL convictions for having mounted threats of violence against a judge , an offence under LAW , and for contempt of court , punishable under LAW . The applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE the applicant was convicted as charged .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG . With reference to its discretional powers under LAW the appeal court rejected the applicant ’s leave to appear , and held the hearing in his absence .
